config.question: What did the U.S. policy called the Truman Doctrine promise to do?

choices.content: to support countries resisting internal or external subjugation
to turn Europe and America into a single economic entity
to establish covert military bases in the Soviet Union
to establish an international agency to monitor the arms race

answer_3.response: In 1947, President Truman asked Congress for money to aid two governments that were then threatened by communist rebels. In what became known as the Truman Doctrine, he made clear that the stakes were far higher than just those two countries: “It must be the policy of the United States to support free peoples who are resisting attempted subjugation by armed minorities or by outside pressure.”
